creator: guido@laures.de
text:
When reloading a webapp via the manager app a ServletRequestListener gets for
every request to the reloaded webapp as many notifications as reloads have been
performed before. In other words: the unregistration of formally registered
listeners seems not to work properly.

I'm seeing this with a ServletContextListener.  If I reload, the config I have
in my contextInitialized() is run twice.  That doesn't happen if I just do a
normal install.

Jake

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
I didn't actually test, but I don't see how it can happen with the current code
(reload() does a stopListener() which removes the listener array, and
startListener() instantiates a new one). Reopen if it still doesn't work, and
give details on how to reproduce (looking at the report, it seems that having a
listener doing a sys.out, and reloading the app, would be enough).

creator: hoju@visi.com
text:
Ok, I no longer see the originally described behavior with a 2003-05-07 build of
Tomcat5, but I do see another similar problem.

At the beginning of application startup, this line is logged...

2003-05-09 10:55:50 createObjectName with
StandardEngine[Catalina].StandardHost[localhost].StandardContext[/myapp]


However, the same thing is done at the end of shutdown.  At the next startup,
that same line is printed out again.  This results in two object of the myapp
context existing.  The context will not work after this.  I just get a 404,
application is not available.

Should this be reported as a new bug or should this bug be re-opened?  BTW, you
can reproduce this by installing/removing any webapp via the manager app.

Jake
